revised_title: Observations on the Reproduction and Development of Hirudo Vulgaris
tldr: The author, James Rawlins Johnson, observes the reproductive and developmental processes of Hirudo vulgaris, a type of leech. He discovers that they reproduce both sexually and asexually, with hermaphroditic copulation and parthenogenesis. The leech lays eggs in capsules, which hatch after three weeks, and the young leeches emerge from the capsule after five more weeks.
